website_summaries.verdict: This jigsaw’s smaller motor makes for a lighter, easier-to-handle saw without compromising cutting accuracy.
pros: 3.9-amp motor is about half the power of other saws but makes for a lighter, easier-to-handle jigsaw
cons: Keyed chuck slows blade changes, though some users find it a more secure option

customer_reviews.title: Works great for softer and thinner woods
customer_reviews.text: Works great for softer and thinner woods, struggles to get through some of the harder finish woods. The jig saw is very easy to handle and manipulate as you're cutting, but definitely need a more powerful saw for cutting through some thicker hard woods. Would recommend it for the price so long as you're aware of its limitations.
customer_reviews.author: MrMkr

customer_reviews.title: ... of Makita tools and this saw is another very good Makita product
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of Makita tools and this saw is another very good Makita product. I really abuse the saw sometimes but the saw will not quit. I use the saw most of the time to cut 2x4 and OSB plates. But I also used it to cut MDF 1' plates. Holds the angle very good and comes in a Plastic storage box. My next project is a greenhouse and I will use this saw for this project and all the others who will follow.
customer_reviews.author: Bavarian Prepper

customer_reviews.title: Skookum choocher
customer_reviews.text: Fantasic build quality and feel when using the tool, as you would expect from Makita. This thing is solid. I've used a few other "budget friendly" jigsaws in the past that felt as if they were going to either vibrate themselves to death or break the saw blade off before you cut through your workpiece. Neither of those sentiments are true here. This thing has all the beans. I really like the little hex key holder built into the rear of the saw too, for those moments when you need a quick blade change.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Trewartha

customer_reviews.title: Solid Makita JigSaw - Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a granite countertop slicing experience. The machine is well built and is professional. I have several other JigSaw from Craftsman and Black&Decker. Nothing compares to a good quality piece of machinery like this. Useful for most intricate and specifically circular cuts with ease. Get the best blade you can afford for best performance and then buy one more, just in case!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Adam

customer_reviews.title: Blade change not quick coupling
customer_reviews.text: The onky downside I could find about this is the blade retention is with an allen screw so it takes some time to change blades which was not a big deal for me since this is strictly for hobby work or smaşl stuff around the house.I would not reccomend for the people whose job is using this all day constantly changing blades. Other than that it was fine for me for a hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the DIYer in you and more!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for over a year now on various projects from cutting plywood to metal bars and it's done exactly what I expected. I LOVE my little companion!!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Fazekas

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Cuts very well with ease
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Cuts very well with ease, is surprisingly lightweight, and easy to maneuver. A perfect saw for DIYers and woodworkers who don't have a need for extras like cordless, dust blowing and light. So far I have used it for cutting plywood, mdf, 2x4 pine, 2x2 redwood and random tree branches with no hiccups at all. The trigger is a little sensitive so be careful when the tool is plugged in and you are carrying it by the handle.
customer_reviews.author: OK

customer_reviews.title: Don't Look Any Further- Buy This Saw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw when I couldn't find replacement blades for my 20-yr. old Black & Decker jigsaw. The Makita came highly recommended by my dad who does a lot of woodworking. I couldn't be happier with it. It cuts through 2x4's like butter. This is the second Makita power tool that I own (hammer drill) and I plan to make this my new power tool company as I replace my older tools.
customer_reviews.author: Boatman77

customer_reviews.title: Needs better shoe adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to get an accurate angle on the shoe of the saw. Usually have to take two quick squares and hold the shoe down around the blade to tighten. I could see how it would be annoying trying to get an accurate cut.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and a good value
customer_reviews.text: Every Makita product I've purchased has been a great tool and this is no exception. This jigsaw is light, easy to control, and cuts like butter. Changing blades is quick and easy. I'm a 49-year-old woodworking hobbyist who loves to use quality tools. This tool is made very well and will probably outlast my ability to use it in the wood shop.
customer_reviews.author: Cary C. Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Saws like it should
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new jig saw and bought this one based on my experience with Makita tools and reading reviews. It seems to work well and my only complaint is not with the excellent saw but the rather poor quality plastic case that the clasps continually fall off of.
customer_reviews.author: D42JEEP

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves it... and me too!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my husband as he loves his Mikita tools. This jigsaw been great and is used regularly, the lines are cut with ease, and the speeds have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Haydock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Craftsman saw with this one. The improvement is unbelievable. For the work I do, this saw will last me a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Ken B

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Great little jigsaw. Very well balanced and smooth. Minimal vibration and creep. For the price, this is an awesome piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Fever

customer_reviews.title: Nice reliable tool
customer_reviews.text: This works fine and has several features which I consider to be above average. Good deal for the money. I prefer this to the cordless as I know it will last for many years without the usual battery fading and losing strength eventually.
customer_reviews.author: stonecold

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: Makita is the last home gamer tools not owned by some Mega Corp inc. They seem to still value Quality and Reputation over profit! never have been unhappy with the teal green
customer_reviews.author: locoman1979

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jigsaw!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent excellent jigsaw. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Van Ryn

customer_reviews.title: Now, I have to learn to use it, but very excited!!,
customer_reviews.text: I still have lots of learning to do, but I’ll get it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holli

customer_reviews.title: A very good jig saw
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy I bought this jig saw. I've used it on a lot of projects and I'm still on the first blade. It's got a very smooth and fluid movement, and plenty of power. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect Reliability for the price
customer_reviews.text: It really pays you to buy this brand. I have the drill set and this is now a further addition. Stupidly I bought a cheaper one initially and quickly returned it within 3 days. Spent the extra and I am extremely happy with this purchase. Its super reliable and has a strong motor to deal with my ongoing projects
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Great house tool
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase! it's easy to use, safe, and efficient to have in every home. You can't go wrong with purchasing this, just do it.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product good price
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with our purchase. The item works great for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: SFS

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: Lines cut very straight. Helps to have the notches to line up the cuts. I like that its a plug in instead of rechargeable battery like my drill. Haven't used it in curved cuts yet but I'm expecting it to handle well as it feels comfy in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: wonderchicksf

customer_reviews.title: vERY Nice Piece , recommended
customer_reviews.text: vERY Nice Piece , recommended, cheap and very nice quality
customer_reviews.author: TIMIKBIMIK

customer_reviews.title: And I'm glad my low quality old saw burned up
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had this saw for the last 25 years. And I'm glad my low quality old saw burned up. Very high quality. Used it to trim joist boards on my new deck and it performs perfectly. Saws easy and straight and very low vibration. Worth every dime I paid for it. Would be nice if it had a light but not worth the extra bucks in my opinion to buy a higher priced model with that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how much I needed a jigsaw until I bought this one. It's fantastically useful, and has all the adjustment that I know what to do with. If I could only have one saw for race car fabrication, something like this would be it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Needed it to cut deck boards to fit around posts. This fit my need perfectly. Took a few practice runs but it worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: RdvG

customer_reviews.title: Great jigsaw
customer_reviews.text: A powerful, well balanced jigsaw. I was surprised how good it is for under $100. I’d suggest this to anyone wanting an affordable jigsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Jane Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and change the blades.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I was using this first time and make my work breeze. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: I love Makita and all their products that I've tried so ...
customer_reviews.text: Again, I love Makita and all their products that I've tried so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Madge

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what he wanted.
customer_reviews.text: My son was given this Makita jigsaw for Christmas, he has stated that he is putting it to good use. This saw was exactly what he needed for numerous projects but didn't know it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice jig saw. We used it to cut bead board. Worked great. Can’t go wrong with Mikita.
customer_reviews.author: S.Reed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Jig Saw
customer_reviews.text: Like all Makita products, this saw is well constructed, easy to use and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  jigsaw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent jigsaw. I bought this mostly because of Makita's reputation and I was not disappointed. The saw is very sturdy and powerful. It cut through 3/4 plywood with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: J. Santana

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, very powerful good value for the $$. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tal Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Makita makes a solid product
customer_reviews.text: Worked well and fit t-shank cutting blades(saws?). Came with the case, one blade, and a manual.
customer_reviews.author: eHyland

customer_reviews.title: A very good saw for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This saw works well and seems to be well made. My only minor complaint is that fore-and-aft adjustment of the shoe can change the blade angle (one screw controls both).
customer_reviews.author: MizzouEngr

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, and I love it already. It cuts great and is easy to control and use. It comes in a nice hard carrying case and includes one blade. Would definitely recommend,
customer_reviews.author: James Borawski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what I use it for, very nicely made. Would buy another Makita.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Was a much needed upgrade to my old craftsman. ...
customer_reviews.text: Was a much needed upgrade to my old craftsman. Latches on the carry case are weak. They are probably OK occasional use by a homeowner but would not hold up to daily contractor use.
customer_reviews.author: gilbert 53

customer_reviews.title: Very nice saw!
customer_reviews.text: Silent, fast and light. Very happy with the feel, control and performance. Have used it to cut some wood, steel, aluminum and ceramics and its easy to use and to quickly change the blades when needed. The plastic material of the saw is great as always with Makita and so is the metal works. Highly recommended for you who want a lighter but still high performing jig saw.
customer_reviews.author: korthaj

customer_reviews.title: Cat door!
customer_reviews.text: Made a cat door with this thing. Worked beautifully! No need for pre-cutting you can slowly ease in to the center of a door which was exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: A Winner!
customer_reviews.text: This saw exceeded my expectations for a saw in this price range! It is powerful, accurate and clean. I can not find a single fault with it. The hard case is a real bonus to keep the tool well protected!
customer_reviews.author: Digitalvellum

customer_reviews.title: The case is great for storage
customer_reviews.text: Works okay, not as refined of a jig saw as my Dad's. He has an older Makita, not sure the model. Is a bit heavy on the vibrations, but can cut a decent line. The case is great for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Purrs as nice as it cuts
customer_reviews.text: I haven't owned it very long, but Makita never disappoints. This saw is destined to become one of my long time favorites. I even love the sound of the motor - sounds like quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Tulalip, WA

customer_reviews.title: ... be formed around log siding and the saw worked like I expected
customer_reviews.text: Just finished a metal roof project where the last piece needed to be formed around log siding and the saw worked like I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Bound

customer_reviews.title: It just works!
customer_reviews.text: Makita make great tools and this is no different. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie W.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding saw!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice saw! Its very adjustable, cuts very smoothly and accurately, and I found that I can readily do fine detail work. I look forward to using this saw every time.
customer_reviews.author: James Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw, Makita quality never fails. Nice adjustable edge guide to make bevel cuts. Nice case with it too. Wish the cord was longer
customer_reviews.author: Yen

customer_reviews.title: Ho hum...another great Makita tool.
customer_reviews.text: Well, my title pretty much says it. I had to toss one of the Ryobi thirty-dollar wonders after about three hours of use. Did what I should have in the beginning and bought this wonderful little saw. Does everything you need and is actually MORE than most of us will require. You can buy a more powerful jig saw if you wish but I have used this repeatedly on 3/4 oak plywood and with a good Bosch blade it just sails right through. I bought the Ryobi while in a hurry and essentially wasted $30. Buy this saw and chances are you will be using it ten years from now if you are a casual user like me.
customer_reviews.author: Warren W. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Jigsaw a real treat
customer_reviews.text: It's a little heavier than I wanted but it cuts a straight line better than any other jigsaw I've ever owned. The blower that gets the sawdust out of the way and the light that allows you to see what you are cutting makes this the best jigsaw I ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Lill

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to complete my project. After doing research on several different jigsaws, this is the one I decided to go with for overall price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: What a great saw
customer_reviews.text: I have used Makita products in the past and this one (model 4329K) is a saw that sounds like motor that will last. It takes the T blade saw blades and it does not chatter or stray from cut. I recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hjermstad

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat this saw for the price - solid feel, minimal vibration, feels good in my hand and easy to maneuver. The usual handy case as with most Makita power tools, very handy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: A must own tool for any serious garage.
customer_reviews.text: A great tool. Comfortable to hold, easily cuts metal, wood, foam, etc. So glad I was able to add this to my workshop!
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Haas

customer_reviews.title: Delightful to use
customer_reviews.text: This saw replaced the little Skil brand saw of my dad's that I burnt up trying to do a simple cut. I was building speaker boxes out of 3/4" MDF, and this saw chews through the stuff like it's barely there. I love my jigsaw and have been using it to replace all the other saws I don't have and don't feel like bumming off my dad. I can cut with this thing about as straight as I can with a circular saw, though that's partially because I'm not great with a circular saw.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Jig saw
customer_reviews.text: Good price and light weight. Easy for the lighter jobs and strong enough for tougher ones a few times. Only failing is no quick chuk change.
customer_reviews.author: Gregor Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: A great tool is one you don't think about, it does its job as intended and with precision. This is a great saw!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Makita Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Makita quality. I don't use this much, but when it is used it never ceases to amaze me how well built this is.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ohara

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it much as yet. Just to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much as yet. Just to cut a corner off a table. Have many up and coming projects to do and I'm sure this will be capable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a few times to cut plywood and it's great. I have no complaints. Does everything it says it will.
customer_reviews.author: Eff

customer_reviews.title: Must have for all homeowners.
customer_reviews.text: What a powerful little thing! Love it! Must have for all homeowners.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandra & Tom

customer_reviews.title: SMOOTH!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little jig saw cant believe i waited so long to get one no regrets here!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Mikita
customer_reviews.text: The best jig saw I ever used. Has plenty of power and gets the job done right.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Z.

customer_reviews.title: excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is a jig saw for those of us who want a simple, sensible sized jig saw with plenty of power and accuracy. The new top end saws are simply too big and heavy. This saw works beautifully for what I need a jig saw to do.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: It feels very high quality, and I use it ...
customer_reviews.text: It feels very high quality, and I use it often. There is a speed setting and a setting to change how much it bites off with each stroke. Both are helpful for adjusting to the project.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable, no problems after 18 months of moderate use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Makita jig saw moderately over the course of 18 months. The variable speed is good. It can rip through plywood like a hot knife through butter (if you have a good blade in). Sometimes the foot/base becomes loose probably has I did not tighten it enough with the Allen key wrench. The plastic guard is very handy, but can become a bit sticky. I should lube the guard track with some silicone spray. At this point I will give 5*.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and well-made jigsaw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high quality jig saw. Exactly as expected from Makita, works great.
customer_reviews.author: DXN-Schuylerville

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makita - quality products and my go to brand for DIY
customer_reviews.author: andrew cook

customer_reviews.title: Better then the Black and Decker model I returned
customer_reviews.text: I returned two Black and Decker jig saws because the blade was being held at the wrong front-to-back angle and bought this at about twice the price. It uses a screw to lock the blade in place, but it's lighter, much quieter and with far less vibration than the Black and Decker saws -- fare more comfortable to us than the Black and Decker model I had. It also comes with its own tough plastic storage/travel case, but it stinks of plastic chemicals -- keep it closed.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Typical great Makita product and excellent Amazon price. Works perfectly. Nice case.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa

customer_reviews.title: Makita 4329K
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and build quality - holds true to the Makita legacy earned from the tools made during my father's generation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable saw. Can't go wrong with makita or dewalt. Work the $$
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Runs as smooth as a high end saw. I would highly recommend this saw. I have used power tools for 35 years and this saw runs like a sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: william mikesh

customer_reviews.title: meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: superior to my old jig saw, operation is smooth and percise, base came loose after a couple cuts and in my opinion could be a little wider
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: review
customer_reviews.text: exactly what he wanted ...works great just in time for him to go back to work and do some more projects around the house...
customer_reviews.author: carolyn dodson

customer_reviews.title: Like butter!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Jig Saw. Does everything that I need it to. Very smooth cutting, like cutting into butter when I use it. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Mendez

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommended
customer_reviews.text: Makita one of my fav brands, excellent, reliable, simple but complete!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Straight cuts and no issues. Solid Makita product as usual.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert M

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Scrolls through 2x4s all day long. For the price it's the best you can get. I've never had a disappointing experience with any makita tool.
customer_reviews.author: Redpoint

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: when i first used, i like it! no problem encountered, perfect tools for me and price was great and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: TEM

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old Black and Decker jig saw which I replaced the motor brushes on once already. This saw is much nicer. Changing blades is quick and easy. I only wish it had a compartment to store blades but I'm sure blades get dull if they are stored in built-in compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Nixa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a diy-er!
customer_reviews.text: I am using the Makita jigsaw to cut out shelves. It's the first time I've ever had a really good jigsaw that cuts accurately, so I am enjoying it immensely. I'm a diy person, so I just do projects at home. It is easy to handle, has plenty of power and is a good buy for the money. I will continue to put it to good use!
customer_reviews.author: Annette Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Over the past 40 yrs I have had two other jig saws. I still have the other two, but this one is really good. It's relatively quiet and very low vibration. In other words, compared to the other two this one is really smoooooth!
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Old Coot

customer_reviews.title: very basic but has everything needed for applications
customer_reviews.text: it doesn't have led nor tool free blade change but it it will work good enough for all your application. in comparison to the other models it has a protection cover at the front.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Neiden

customer_reviews.title: In my none professional hands doing professional job so easy with pleasure
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal tool. In my none professional hands doing professional job so easy with pleasure. Multi speed is super! I used another company tool before. Day and night!
customer_reviews.author: ilya fishov

customer_reviews.title: An excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few jigsaws before but this one is my favorite- it's a sturdy little saw and cuts more precisely than other jigsaws, at a very reasonable price. I like the compact design as well. I only gave 4 stars because the replacement blades are hard to locate, but I am using a t-shank blade from a different brand and it works just fine.

customer_reviews.title: perfect tool for my Collins Coping Foot
customer_reviews.text: I chose this tool to be adapted for coping crown molding. By replacing the shoe with a Collins coping foot attachment, I'm able to cope crown/base and cap molding in a fraction of the time, than by hand. This saw is light weight and aggressive enough to do the job flawlessly. I like the orbital feature which is great when working with stain grade hardwoods. Perfect lite-duty saw.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Lieberman

customer_reviews.title: Great jigsaw. Wish the blades were easier to come ...
customer_reviews.text: Great jigsaw. Wish the blades were easier to come by but a makita grade product that lives up to its name.
customer_reviews.author: JRB

customer_reviews.title: Best Little Jigsaw Out There
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my old Black & Decker jigsaw, and I trust Makita quality.This saw is not terribly expensive, it isn't overloaded with extras-it just does what one needs a jigsaw for.So far, it is exactly what I was looking for-a quality but simple tool.Every Makita tool I have purchased seems to last forever, and I hope and expect that this jigsaw will do the same.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Hitchen

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I got this "used" it came with the fresh blade still sealed and all original packaging It was a great price and it cuts straight, fast, and smooth would recommend the used option when available but even full price is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: Very well made machine. Does the job and does it well.
customer_reviews.author: tvgnus

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good price for quality jig saw. angle adjustment kinda finicky compared to high end models. not variable speed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: SON FEATURE I LIKE ABOUT THIS JIGSAW IS THE VARIABLE SPEED CONTROL, THAT ALLOW TO PUT IN A SPEED YOU WANT, THEN PUSH THE POWER BUTTON. I USED IN A WOOD WORK AND WITH THE BLADE CAME IN THE BOX AND THE CUT EAS SMOOF AND CLEAN.
customer_reviews.author: BERTITO

customer_reviews.title: really very satisfied with the product
customer_reviews.text: really very satisfied with the product, good quality, arrived in good condition, is special for small jobs, the shipping was very fast. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Byron Morales Muñoz

customer_reviews.title: Blade never fully 90 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this jigsaw, because I believe it was one of the best for it's price range. I have used it for four full days, and using them with B-23 Makita blades. When you tighten the blade the bolt pushes alongside the blade tip in there and knocks it slightly off 90 degrees. It may be 89 degrees. I think it would have been a better designed jigsaw if it had bolts on either side and you would tighten them symmetrically so that the blade ended up exactly square and in the center of the roller.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice smooth running saw. I am a Makita fan and this is another excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS R.

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: i like this a brand and have not had a chance to use this at this time waiting for summer work
customer_reviews.author: Helen G

customer_reviews.title: I Love It.
customer_reviews.text: I love this jig saw has great power very good grip well built with great quality fun to use solid a great purchase very happy seller did a great job in all areas well done Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sam

customer_reviews.title: Looks good!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I didn't get to use it much so far, but I'm sure looking forward to start some new projects!
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Pier Bruneau

product_meta.title: Top Handle Jig Saw
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
The Makita 4329K Top Handle Jig Saw combines power with a compact design and ease-of-use features for a range of cutting applications.



The 4329K is engineered with a powerful 3.9 amp motor. The variable-speed control dial (500-3,100 spm) delivers optimal cutting performance in a variety of materials. The die-cast aluminum base bevel cuts 45 degrees right or left with a positive stop at 90 degrees for solid cutting performance.The 4329K has three orbital settings plus straight cutting and features an ergonomically designed, rubberized grip to provide more comfort and control. A through-the-body dust port provides optimal dust management with the use of a clear dust cover and vacuum. The counterweight balancing system is engineered for reduced vibration and improved user comfort. The saw also features a large trigger switch for easy operation and lock-on button for extended use.

The 4329K has a compact design at only 8-7/8 inches long and weighs only 4.2 pounds. The saw is ideal for professional woodworkers, cabinetry makers, and specialized residential construction workers who require a superior jig saw in a compact size. The 4329K is just another example of Makita's commitment to innovative technology and best-in-class engineering.

About Makita Saws
Cut after cut, Makita saws deliver power, performance, and capacity with less weight and more ease-of-use features. Makita has a full range of corded and cordless saws and blades for cutting wood, metal, and masonry, including table saws, miter saws, reciprocating saws, circular saws, jig saws, metal cutting saws, plunge saws, and more, as well as a complete line of blades and accessories.

About Makita
Makita is a worldwide manufacturer of industrial-quality power tools and offers a wide range of industrial accessories. Makita applies leading-edge innovation to engineer power tools that are compact and energy efficient, yet deliver industrial-strength power and results. Makita U.S.A., Inc. is located in La Mirada, California, and operates an extensive distribution network located throughout the U.S. For more information, please call 800/4-MAKITA (800/462-5482) or visit makitatools.com. Makita is Best-in-Class Engineering.

Warranty
Every Makita tool is thoroughly inspected and tested before leaving the factory. If you are not satisfied with any Makita tool within 30 days of purchase, return it and Makita will provide a replacement or refund. Each Makita tool is warranted to be free of defects from workmanship and materials for the period of ONE YEAR from the date of original purchase. Should any trouble develop during this one-year period, return the COMPLETE tool, freight prepaid, to one of Makita's Factory or Authorized Service Centers. Please see makitatools.com for complete details.

What's in the Box
Makita 4329K Top Handle Jig Saw, blade, wrench, and tool case.




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Makita 4329K variable-speed top-handle jig saw combines a powerful 3.9 amp motor with three orbital settings plus straight cutting for use in making a wide variety of cuts. A die-cast aluminum base adjusts up to 45 degrees right or left and positive stop at 90 degrees for solid cutting performance. The 4329K has an 11/16-inch length of stroke, with a wood cutting capacity of 2-9/16 inches at 90 degrees and a steel cutting capacity of 1/4 inches at 90 degrees. The motor is dynamically balanced for 40 percent less tool vibration and lower noise than competitive models.
The 4329K also includes features to enhance the user experience. The ergonomically designed rubberized grip and large trigger with lock-on button switch provide more comfort and control, and the counterweight balancing system reduces vibration. A variable-speed dial control (500-3,100 SPM) optimizes cutting performance in a variety of materials and the through-the-body dust port provides excellent dust management with the use of a clear dust cover and vacuum. The 4329K comes with a jig-saw blade, a carrying case, and an on-board hex wrench for fast and easy blade changes and bevel adjustments.
